dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 3067 IH: Corruption in Argentina Stymied by Enforcing Sanctions Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Ms. Salazar (for herself, Mr. Gimenez, Mr. Lawler, and Mrs. González-Colón) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To provide for the imposition of sanctions with respect to certain officials of Argentina.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Corruption in Argentina Stymied by Enforcing Sanctions Act of 2023 or the CASES Act of 2023.

section.header: Imposition of sanctions with respect to certain officials of Argentina

subsection.text: Not later than 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, and annually thereafter, the Secretary of State shall submit to Congress a report with respect to each individual specified in subsection (c) that includes—

paragraph.text: a description of the assets of the individual, including—

subparagraph.text: the estimated net worth of the individual;
the estimated net worth of the immediate family members of the individual; and

a description of all of the individual's real, personal, and intellectual property, bank or investment or similar accounts, and any other financial or business interests or holdings, whether obtained legitimately or illegitimately; and

paragraph.text: a determination with respect to whether the individual meets the criteria for the imposition of sanctions under section 7031(c) of the Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 2023 (division K of Public Law 117–328).

subsection.text: If the President makes an affirmative determination under subsection (a)(2) with respect to an individual, the President shall impose sanctions under section 7031(c) of the Department of State, Foreign Operations, and Related Programs Appropriations Act, 2023, with respect to the individual.
The individuals specified in this subsection are the following:

paragraph.text: Cristina Elisabet Fernández de Kirchner, born on February 19, 1953, in La Plata, Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Máximo Kirchner, born on February 2, 1977, in La Plata, Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Juan Martin Mena, born on February 25, 1979, in Mar del Plata, Buenos Aires, Argentina.
Oscar Isidro José Parrilli, born on August 13, 1951, in San Martín de Los Andes, Neuquén, Argentina.
Carlos Alberto Zannini, born on August 27, 1954, in Villa Nueva, Córdoba, Argentina.
